answers.answer: Difficult to say without evaluation, and you clearly have been worked up extensively by several physicians.At this time, I would pursue and endocrine approach.  Indeed, problems with the thyroid or testosterone level would cause some of the systemic symptoms that you describe.A low resistance to illness may warrant an immunology workup, as well as a complete blood count.  If there are problems with the latter, a peripheral blood smear and referral to a hematologist can be considered.Regarding the liver, the enzymes are at a moderately high level.  If it continues, or starts to rise, a liver biopsy can be considered for a more definitive diagnosis.These options can be discussed with your personal physician.  Appropriate referrals to an endocrinologist, immunologist, or GI physician (for the liver) can be considered.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patients education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.www.kevinmd.com
